I'm trying my best not to give out spoilers because I hate knowing what's going to happen before I see a movie. But the general idea is that Hancock is a superhero who basically hates the world and the world hates him (except when they need him) You can see that he is obviously depressed which leads to his drinking, which leads to a wake of damage left in his path as he tries to fulfill his roll as a superhero. We watch as he goes from being an anti-hero to a superhero that the people can get behind.I loved everything about this movie. The acting was very good, special effects were great and it had a lot of comedic moments in this film. My comment is not here for the HATERS. You can go to the Godfather or Shawshank Redemption page and you'll have idiots saying they were the worse movies ever made. For whatever reason they want to hate so....let them hate. This comment is for the Will Smith fans who think these haters are right. I promise to all the Will Smith fans out there, you will not be disappointed. In fact, tomorrow I'm going to see it again. And trust me, this is something I haven't done in about 10 years!

Review title: Potential, but winds up as typical Hollywood...
Review_body: wow... I was soooo looking forward to this movie! I finished watching it an hour ago and I'm still trying to figure out if I thought it was good or not.The first third of the movie is AMAZING, I remember watching it and thinking wow, this is one of the first superhero movies I've seen that has potential to win an academy award. Will Smith is an incredible actor and the story has some real flesh to it.The twist comes, and it all starts going downhill. No longer is there any real drama or tension, it's all Hollywood goop with no substance and bing bang boom plot devices that don't go together but make an okay summer blockbuster.It's sad because they build you up at the start for a fall by the end.

I'm not a big fan of superhero films, but this one got me because it was so outside the box. An everyday miserable alcoholic guy with super powers. Hhmmmm, not evil nor good, just a guy that's become antisocial and complacent from these powers. He helps people here and there, but screws it up. How would depression and loneliness affect a person with super powers? I've given away a lot already, but this film actually fascinated me on a philosophical level. I guess I think too much. It could've delved more into the characters and back story. If done well enough, a sequel would be interesting.

John Hancock is a superhero with an attitude problem: he hates everyone. He suffers from amnesia, and can't remember parts of his life. He drinks and he's not the best example of a superhero. Then comes executive Ray Embrey (Jason Bateman), whose life is saved by Hancock, and he vows to help Hancock turn into a reputable person of society. His wife, Mary (Charlize Theron) seems to have a connection with Hancock as well.As Hancock turns a new leaf and becomes a superhero people can count on, a shocking revelation sends Hancock's life into a tailspin as he learns who he truly was, and is, and his connections with people that seem random but really aren't.This wasn't the best superhero movie to date, but it wasn't the worst. The storyline was compelling although not enough time was given to fully maximize the potential of it. Will Smith, as always, did a fantastic job, but the whole film seemed choppy and out of focus with the overall theme. Nonetheless, it was still a decent action flick.

"Hancock" was a very solid effort all around.Will Smith is John Hancock, with most of the powers we usually associate with Superman. But he is a social misfit, seemingly with no direction in his life. He is a loner, living in a trailer near the ocean, and seems to spend most of his spare time with a bottle of booze to his mouth. As a result, when the cops seek him out to help, he flies erratically, shearing off parts of buildings in the process, tends to tear up the road with his landings, and destroys cars, trucks, and trains that happen to be nearby. As a result the public has a love/hate feeling about Hancock, and lately mostly hate.Hancock doesn't know his history. Eighty years earlier he woke up in a Miami hospital and didn't know who he was. When it was time to release him he was asked to "put your John Hancock here" and assumed his name was John Hancock! Because of his superpowers he doesn't age as a normal person would.Into the picture comes Jason Bateman as P.R. expert Ray Embrey. Ray sees an opportunity to polish Hancock's image, to make him more valuable to society and turn him into a gentleman. Part of that was for Hancock to submit to prison time for all the things he had destroyed, and in the process learn to quit drinking.The third key character is Charlize Theron as Ray's wife, Mary Embrey. We notice that she is very hesitant when she first meets Hancock at her home, but we don't know why. But it becomes an important part of the story.So here we have 3 very good actors in Smith, Bateman, and Theron. They create very interesting characters and the movie is very entertaining. While it starts out looking more like a broad comedy, it in fact ends up having a nice dramatic story embedded as well.

Review title: I really don't understand why people don't like this movie other than...
Review_body: This super hero story is closer to what I imagine it would really be like in real life except for the Ghost Busters fight scene. In all the other super hero movies you never get to see real people. It is always cartoonish. You know, dark swirly clouds. They could have left that and the bad language out. Still, I think this is a great candidate for a second movie. Won't happen though. One thing that always kills a movie in the US is blacks and whites kissing. Personally I don't care but facts is facts. Look at the data. Now that "Hancock" has been introduced to us, I'd love to see a second movie more on the serious side. It would be cool to see what would happen if Hancock got involved in some real life type issue we deal with in today's world like the many wars going on around the world. A super hero doesn't always need to have Kryptonite. Fighting an unwinable war would be interesting for a super hero. It is always the same story line though with the movie industry. Hancock was just a little different. I enjoyed it.

Hancock is exactly what you would expect if a normal person was suddenly imbued with super powers. Jason Bateman is at his best in this movie, and Will Smith was the perfect pick to play Hancock. The two of them together are so natural that I am surprised they have not done more movies together. I love this movie for the touching story of life and regret as well as the action and super hero antics. It has everything you could want from a movie and more. If you have not seen it you should watch it now.

Review title: two scripts, same actors and props
Review_body: i now see what possibly makes many people trash the flick.it was two movies in one, joined with the same efficiency as stitching two concrete blocks together with a needle and thread.the first film, the blockbuster material, unique spin on a super hero, was about a hobo hero who gets a face lift from good pr.then that film ended.then , a not-as-engaging, flick about an alien couple who must be apart from each other started. and somehow they forgot to change the actors and props.8 stars for the first half though.

Review title: Could Have Used A Better Villain But Great Movie.
Review_body: Hancock is about a superhero that really isn't your average superhero like Superman or Batman. He has bad behavior, is a heavy drinker, and kind of hates his job. But when he saves a guy, Ray Embrey, from getting hit by a train, Embrey wants to help Hancock with his image and teach him to love doing what he does. Hancock has super strength and can fly but does really have an outfit. Also he's not really liked by the people as he doesn't really like them either. Hancock, from what I can say and people can agree with me, has the power to start arguments with the people and has a way with words for them.The only problem I have with this movie is the lack of thought for a SUPERvillian. Ray's wife, Mary, who is just like Hancock in every way besides their sex, can be called a villain at some point. But, it would have been sweet it there was another villain with superpowers that it would take both Hancock and Mary to stop him. But overall, Hancock is a great superhero movie. Maybe a sequel can come soon.9/10 for me.

Review title: Plot holes hurt an otherwise excellent movie
Review_body: This is spoiler-free up to the part that says "SPOILERS." Hancock is the story of antihero John Hancock (Will Smith) with superhero powers who saves the life of optimist Ray Embrey (Jason Bateman) who happens to be in PR. As a way of saying thank you, Ray works with Hancock to change his negative public image into something positive. The characters are moderately complex and the movie goes from comedic with some dramatic elements to dramatic with some comedic bits.First of all, I'd like to talk about all the good things in this movie. The acting, characters, cinematography, dialogue and directing are all great. And the musical score. Wow. Now I am never one for caring much about music in a movie, but I was absolutely blown away at how much the music added to the movie. If you're fine with accepting everything that happens in a movie as plausible even outside the perceived confines of the fictional universe then you should like this movie. Were the plot holes less damning, I would rate this movie an 8 easily. I still highly recommend this movie.*****SPOILERS***** Now time for the plot holes and other spoilers. The first one is simply nitpicking. When Hancock throws the boy Michelle up in the air, the sudden acceleration at both the beginning and end of Michelle's journey surely would have killed him.More problematic is when Hancock goes to prison and most of the inmates circle and threaten him. In much the same way that a mugger with a knife as a weapon won't attack an entire swat team, a group of unarmed thugs would not logically attack the equivalent of Superman. Sure there might be a few crazy inmates who would think they could do something, but not the dozens shown in the movie.Last is the whole thing about Hancock and Mary losing their powers whenever they are close. The proximity and duration, the only two factors affecting their power loss, seem to be inconsistent throughout the movie. They lived in the same city for years so the distance has to be relatively small. Since this is the case, Hancock should not have gotten injured at the liquor store if Mary was at her home as was shown in the previous scene. That would most likely have been ample distance between the two for them to remain immortal. Still, after Hancock got shot, Mary should have fled the city ASAP after she found out Hancock got shot. That way Hancock could have gotten healed almost immediately. She could have then returned and he left then all would be fine.Not a plot hole but still a spoiler: The hospital scene when Hancock is about to get killed and Ray comes to save the day is far too comedic for the mood set by the preceding 10 minutes and by the following 3 minutes. I would have been perfectly fine if Ray had knocked out the villain, but chopping off his other hand in addition to the lack of music, the villain's comment of "You didn't!" and the panning to his hook hand completely destroys the mood. Those five seconds absolutely destroy the movie and that is the biggest flaw with the movie, easily costing it 1 star.

Wow. What a movie. I went in thinking this was just your run of the mill summer action movie, But let me tell you, it is all that and then some. The story was awesome, the acting was fantastic, the whole thing was just great. I'm not going to go into what the movie was about because everyone already knows, but let me tell you, your money will not be wasted on this movie. I laughed, I was wowed by the special effects, and get this, it even brought tears to my eyes more than once. A terrific job by everyone involved. My hat is off to all of you. Thanks. This is the kind of movie that makes you remember why you love to go to the movies. I know none of the people who were in it or made it will probably ever read this but if they do, Thank you. You should all be incredibly proud of yourselves.

Based on all the negative reviews coming out on Hancock. I thought going in this movie would be pretty bad. Batman and Robin bad. Catwoman bad. Wild Wild West bad. Speed Racer bad. But lo and behold it delivers the goods. I agree with the consensus that the first half is funny and has all the jokes and the second half gets all serious and dark. But I thought that it worked. Will, Jason, and Charlize were all great. The effects were good, not great. I just imagined that this would be a total train wreck of a movie and it's nowhere close to that. It's entertaining and I actually plan to see it again. That's why I say a person is their own best critic. Don't listen to the media. As far as ranking Hancock with the other pics of the summer that I've seen I would say Iron Man, Indy, Hancock, Prince Caspian, Wanted, and The Incredible Hulk. Haven't seen any other ones yet. But I'm glad Hancock turned out to be good.
With all the superhero movies to this day, still the most underrated one for me.

I have never been more sorely disappointed with a film in my entire life. Peter Berg apparently didn't to know who he made the movie for as parts seem geared toward a younger demographic (Will Smith doing ridiculous things that are cartoonish and physically impossible) while other moments are quite adult (certain scenes border on an R-rating). These elements would be fine if Hancock were purely and action movie for grown-ups or a light-hearted comedy for the whole family, but it just doesn't work trying to have them both in the same film. Also, the comedy just didn't "click" for me, it seemed out of place and childish, and the entire role of the guy from Arrested Development (an AWFUL show in my opinion) didn't need to be there - and the same goes for Charlize Theron's character. The shaky cam was distracting, the characters were unlikable (other than Hancock), the story was whack, and as with I am Legend, the Fresh Prince is the only saving grace, but unlike that movie, the depths of his acting talent cannot save a movie that is this broken. Worst of all, the best scenes were in the trailers, making them more entertaining to watch than the actual thing - I almost asked my friends if they wanted to walk out. The one good thing in it - the action - does not last nearly long enough to warrant the rest of the picture. Do yourself a favor, even if you love Will Smith, and save your money. Check this website before watching another Will Smith movie, and never see another one of Peter Berg's messes.

A nice action flick with lol moments in abundance. Changes tone in second half and I didn't have any problems with that just more for the buck. Loved the acting, all the main characters have great charisma and likability. Overall, well above average and highly enjoyable.

Review title: Refreshing new angle in a sea of 'Same old' superhero movies
Review_body: I'm surprised that I liked this movie so well. I went in with pretty low expectations.Take a moment to readjust your perspective. Hancock is not your typical superhero movie. The villains are not larger than life. This is a movie with the premise of what might it really be like if there were superheroes among us.The twist is fun, and adds some explanation to an otherwise random meeting of people. Are there cheesy bits? Yes. Would it have been a better movie without some of the more unnecessary crASS comedy? Yes. But overall, we laughed, we empathized, we left the theater happy and talking about the subtleties. What more could you ask for for a summer popcorn flick, really?

Hancock was the highly anticipated Will Smith superhero movie about a super who's not really quite the hero. It was Will's 8th blockbuster film in a row, making him the only actor in history to achieve such a feat. The trailer was hilarious, it was visually astounding, and it stirred up quite a buzz. So how was the movie?Story: 5/5 Buckets Of Popcorn Hancock is the story of a single man on Earth with superhuman powers but not the super hero mentality. He rises to the needs of the public, but not nearly as gracefully as, say, Spider-Man or even The Incredible Hulk.With alcoholic tendencies, a general disregard for public property, Hancock serves as the ultimate conundrum: he saves the day, but causes millions in damage; he helps uphold the law, all while breaking it at the same time. The cops want him arrested, but how do you capture a super hero?Well I'll try to not to divulge too much of the movie, because it's quite good really. But suffice it to say that this problem is creatively overcome by Hancock happening across a public relations manager (Jason Bateman) whose wife (Charlize Theron) doesn't approve of the hapless hero being around.Bateman suggests that Will turn himself in to clean up his public image so that he won't be hated everywhere he goes, he does some time in jail until the police chief calls in for his help, and Hancock saves the day in a mass of broken glass, bullets, and explosions.Ordinarily, this would only warrant a few Popcorn Buckets, but I didn't tell you about the second half, which is awesome and earns the story a full 5 Buckets Of Popcorn out of 5.Acting: 4/5 Buckets Of Popcorn If you've been paying attention to the film world at all, you'd know that this cast is renowned for its on screen presence. Jason Bateman's Emmy-nominated and Golden Globe-winning, Carlize Theron is an Academy Award winner, and Will Smith has gotten better with age like a good bottle of wine. Earning 2 Oscar nods, Will has shown growth like no other since his 2004 blockbuster I, Robot into the charming, mature actor he is today.In the movie, Bateman plays the perfect regular human buddy of the hero, torn between his appreciation and gratitude toward Hancock for saving his life and his wife who has little but contempt for him.Charlize gives another fantastically convincing performance as the bitter, cautious wife of Bateman, which really comes to life in the second half of the movie...which I'm not telling you about.Will shows us a side of him that we rarely get to see as the gritty, uncaring ne'er-do-well that Hancock is. He is still true to his comedic stylings that made us all love The Fresh Prince from the beginning, but he comes with the acting chops that got him nominated in Pursuit Of Happiness.This movie really does ride more on its special effects and great story, but the performances and subtle nuances and mannerisms that these three bring to the movie earn Hancock 4 out of 5 Buckets Of Popcorn.Entertainment: 5/5 Buckets Of Popcorn Entertainment?! This movie's got it in spades! From beginning to end, this is good old fashioned fun, the way that Will Smith's always done it. I mean, come on, it's a super hero movie. If it wasn't entertaining, it would've totally missed the mark.The movie starts off with Hancock hilariously sleeping on a park bench, hung-over from liquor consumption, and being called to duty by a little boy. To start his heroics off right, he dashes off into the sky, destroying the park bench and sidewalk where he took off from.He zooms through the Los Angeles skies, smashing through highway signs, destroying the road, and ultimately impaling the SUV of the bad guys on the steeple of the Met-Life building. This scene's got everything entertainment requires: hilarious dialogue, gunfire, invincibility, flying, destruction, and the ultimate ridiculous scenario of a truck hanging from the top of a building.As the movie continues along, the hilarity tones down a bit form the high comedy to a more tame (save for one jailhouse scene), becoming more focused on the story and the special effects that make this movie so much fun.Again, in the second half that I'm not going to talk about here, the movie shifts into high gear, resulting in one of the more entertaining movies of this decade. 5 out of 5 Buckets Of Popcorn.Movie Magic: 4/5 Buckets Of Popcorn Sticking to the formula that first made him a star in Independence Day, continued his success in Men In Black, shined through in I, Robot, and most of his other movies, Will has created another summer blockbuster with amazing special effects.From flying, to explosions, to wind storms, throwing a whale across a beach, and all the other supernatural feats that take place, this movie delivers up a heavy batch of movie magic that you won't soon forget.It's not the same spaceship battles, blowing up cities effects you get in ID4, but they definitely know how to sell a movie with some CGI. For that, Hancock receives 4 out of 5 Buckets Of Popcorn.Overall Score: 4.5/5 Buckets Of Popcorn - At Least My 2nd Favorite Will Smith MoviePlease visit http://www.celebsystem.com for more Popcorn Bucket Reviews.

Review title: best movie i've seen in months
Review_body: The only thing i can say is you should see this movie, it worths all the money. I really haven't seen such a good movie for months! Great special effects, great actors, great plot. When i bought tickets to this film i wasn't sure it was the right choice, because i find the superhero movies kind of boring and predictable, but this one is a really unic idea, dotted with a lot of funny moments(i didn't expect to laugh watching a superhero movie), also with some romantic and dramatic moments. So if you wanna have some quality time watching a good movie, trust me, you should see Hancock. I definitivly recommend it! I'm 100% sure you won't be sorry!

OK people this is my first comment ever so don't flame me to hard OK. I watched this movie yesterday and i must say i was surprised by it. Hancock is a superhero movie and i must say i don't like them very much. A friend of mine convinced me to come with him and we enjoyed the movie i must say.What makes this movie fun to watch is Will Smith and his so recognizable humor. And that its not an average superhero movie, the plot is a little different from spider man, iron man and those other Marvel productions.Don't expect to much from this movie, it does what it does. My opinion is that if you don't expect to much you will enjoy yourself.

This movie does not live up to the hype at all. I don't even know where to begin. As a comic reader I don't think the idea of a substance abusing superhero is all that new, however, it's not something we see on film that often so kudos to the makers for that. That, however, does not save the film from an underdeveloped story with characters I didn't give a crap about. The ending was so anticlimactic, the vague origin of Hancock and Mary felt uninspired and too convenient, and the humor was hackneyed and unoriginal. It turned into a different movie halfway through and got really boring.I can honestly say this movie was worse than what I was expecting (and I wasn't expecting much after seeing the trailers). It's not a good popcorn movie; it's not even a good TV dinner movie. I wish I had seen WALL-E instead.

This movie has received a lot of negative feedback due to people disliking the genre. These nay-sayers have most likely not even seen the movie or walked into the theater with a bad taste in their mouths and were determined to denounce the film before even watching it. With that being said Hancock is not revolutionary, however, you won't be dissatisfied when exiting the theater after seeing this film. Will Smith and Charlize Theron being their full spectrum of experience to the screen and definitely do not leave this film lacking in emotion. Hancock contains an even mix of comedy, romance, and action and fully delivers as an unorthodox action superhero film. The one annoyance to the film is Jason Bateman's similar acting style in Hancock to his character in Arrested Development. Though his acting is fitting for his role in Hancock, it is also very stereotypical for Bateman and comes of a bit irritating when the movie includes stills of Bateman's facial expressions that are identical to his expressions in Arrested Development. Overall the movie was a solid 8.0 and might even be considered an 8.5 for sheer originality in the superhero film genre.

I LOVE all of Will Smith movies.This is one of his best yet.Can't wait to see it.If movie reviews have to do with my favorite actors.I usually don't care what people say unless it's good.A great actor like him doesn't need bad comments on his movies, but then I can't change peoples minds.Say what u want to say about ''Hancock'' I going to see to see and enjoy another great summer movie.Can't wait to see what other movies he will be taking out in the future.I'm just really shocked to why doesn't he have a Oscar award yet for best actor.This movie is really worth seeing, and not a waste of time or money like some people say.

Review title: This movie is actually not THAT bad.
Review_body: Hancock - A very entertaining and fresh look at the superhero genre.I went into this movie having seen a picture of it on the NYTimes.com, and my only other knowledge being that Will Smith is in it and it has SOMETHING to do with superheroes. Having seen it with no expectation I have to say it was a great summer movie. Jason Bateman is very funny as per usual, and I truly enjoyed Will Smith in his role as the foul, dirty, whiskey chugging, superhero. I thought the role was surprisingly dark for Mr. Smith and I generally enjoyed the concept of an apathetic superhero. The action sequences were good enough, but most of all I was pleased not to be watching a Marvel Brand movie, which I for one and COMPLETELY sick of seeing over and over and over and over. This movie offered a lighter mood to heroes and allowed us to laugh at them, which is something I would definitely like to see more of.I think too many people are giving this movie a hard time, when it really is a solid summer movie. Not film of the year by a long shot, but quality entertainment for a few summer dollars.
I believe that this is one of the most underrated movies that I can remember. Not sure why there are so many low ratings, I think it gets better with time.!

Review title: seriously one of the best movies i have seen in long time!
Review_body: First off i was hesitant to see this movie because of some of the negative reviews on here... glad i did see it! It was great! The plot was original and the choice of actors was exceptional! Some people said the story dragged, i didn't think it did at all! It actually went by too fast, they could have added more scenes! Will smith was great, and i am in love with Jason Batemen! When he starts to become the lovable hero, you cant help but wish he was real! the twist was amazing, i honestly didn't see it coming! and i usually guess a lot of movie twists! if you like comedy, action, and just an all around great summer flick.... Go see Hancock!!!!

Good idea but poor execution. It starts with a dull action sequence and ends with a very poor and too much guessable ending. Good acting but poor direction makes this film a missed opportunity. Quite boring. Waste of time. Don't watch.

Hancock is action packed from beginning to end, one of the best Will Smith films of all time and the best film of this year... John Hancock is an alcoholic with a very bad temper and doesn't take to kindly to being called an 'arsehole' Will Smith keeps you entertained and wanting more the way everything came together was absolute genius... Charlize Theron's character comes across has prim and proper but when you get to see the character in her true light it is shocking and complete genius on the writers part... Hancock had me laughing from start to finish... I also had tears because you see his character in a light you wouldn't expect... Hancock is absolute genius at its best and has one hundred percent thumbs up from me.

Contains SpoilersNow this right here happens very rare, but when it does, it means the movie was very sweet... You know how after watching a certain movie, right when the credits starts, you say to yourself: "I wish i could erase the last one hour and 30 minutes from my memory, just so i could watch and enjoy this magnificent movie all over again. Well to me thats exactly how Hancock was. Before watching it, i didn't know anything about the movie. I didn't watch the previews, i didn't see any trailers, i didn't watch any news or read any critics. All i knew was that Will Smith was starring in it.. So as u can see, i didn't have any expectations. And thats probably why i liked it so much. Oh and if i hadn't mentioned it already, i stopped watching previews years ago, just because while watching it you get to see half the movie already anyways.. Now if i had watched the trailer for Hancock i would have already known about his powers, his character, his attitude towards people and vice versa. I would have known all about how he could fly to the moon when he had to. So what I'm trying to say is, there would have been nothing that could have shock or surprise me.I do have a couple of criticism about the movie though.. The first one is: yep you guessed it, its the fruity looking superhero suit. He looked a lot like a hero when he had the bum outfit and an alcohol bottle in his hand. The second was the ending, it was great up until he was doing all that jumping just to bring that chick back to life. But right after that, 1 month later, he gives Ray and Mary a call with a blue-tooth device on his ear (which i have no idea where or how he found the money for) and tells them to look up to the sky where he has made a heart shape on the moon, and just takes off.. The movie was so good that it left the crappy ending in the shade... P.s: never watch the previews, specially if its a comedy movie preview, and you'll be fine...

Review title: It's July 4th again, and when there's fireworks, there's Will Smith
Review_body: I went into this film expecting an overly family-friendly superhero story with some slight twists and witty lines from Jason Bateman (of Arrested Development fame...or anti-fame), but I was pleasantly surprised to find a considerably rougher-around-the-edges kind of movie. Smith does an excellent job as the drunken, down-and-out, and absolutely alone superhero who always acts to help, but ends up simply hurting. Jason Bateman plays his standard, business-man type character and does it well as he always has (I fear for his type-casted future though...). The film was explosive, sad, gritty, and sometimes even quite epic while always maintaining an atmosphere of hope and light-heartedness, more akin to a strictly PG type of movie. From the moment the film started to when the credits started to roll, than stopped briefly for a final scene, before continuing again, I enjoyed myself. Will it win any Oscars? Surely not, The Dark Night is already being handed all of those. Is it my favorite movie? No, definitely not.Was it a good movie? Absolutely.Hancock is everything that you want in a summer blockbuster. Plain and Simple.

Review title: GREAT MOVIE!!! different than the typical superhero film.
Review_body: I'll try to make my comments short and sweet. I thought the movie was great. It had plenty of action and a great plot. I was glued to the screen the whole time and not wanting the movie to end. All actors and actresses did a great job with their roles. I never used to care for Will Smith too much, but man this guy has been doing amazing lately. I'm looking forward to seeing what he does next.Back to the movie, From what I hear the people that didn't enjoy it as much blame it on the quality of some special effects, but the average eye wouldn't notice a thing wrong with them. Also a few people aren't into the twist the movie throws..(Which is completely original) I wont go any further into that.Overall, the movie is awesome. Give it a chance for sure. Though, I warn you, if you are wanting another superman or spider man... don't watch Hancock.

I saw this movie today and I must say it was damn good.Not even for a second it lets you blink your eyes..The action sequences are totally awesome and the one liners are very well written and delivered ( by who else but Will Smith!!). As for the story, it is fast paced and takes an unexpected turn in the second half. The humor in the first half of the movie was nothing less than riveting.It has all the ingredients for a summer blockbuster.Will Smith is a largely under rated actor and I think given a good author backed role he is definitely an Oscar material. As for the critics , what is wrong with them? This movie definitely deserves more. You can go and see it with your family and don't forget your popcorn!!

I give this movie a perfect five, because half of it is awesome. Walk out after the bank robbery scene, the same one you saw in the trailer. Just get up grab your stuff and leave right after that scene. You'll regret every moment you watch after that. The second half is confused and rushed. You could write a better ending in the parking lot with your friends, I actually wrote a couple in the theater, it distracted me from what I was watching. It's amazing how many ways this concept could have easily held together with just a little of thought and creativity. But alas movies, are becoming less and less a creative industry.

Review title: Best Superhero Movie Ever because it's Believable!
Review_body: This movie is great! At first I wasn't sure what to make of the movie from the previews I couldn't tell if it was a comedy or drama. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised after I watched the movie. There is a wonderful balance of comedy and action. Also, there is a love story and a great twist. It makes you laugh and cry. Review title: Enjoyable enough but it's no Iron Man
Review_body: This film was entertaining enough, but an idea this rich should have been much better. Truly surprising twist. Doesn't overcome the unappealing explanation... or the unsatisfactory villain, or the nausea producing camera-work.Great casting. Jason Bateman brings nice notes, but the character is a little thin. Will Smith looks like he's having a great time playing an a**hole. Just don't call him one! (The quote about calling him a "Jackass" - that's not the word they use in the film.)If you try to be careful about making the most of your movie dollar, wait for the DVD and go see Iron Man again.In fact, when the DVD comes out, skip it and rent Iron Man again. Iron Man is satisfying in ways that Hancock can't come close to.But if you're determined to see it, go. You'll probably enjoy it.

Review title: A promising start and a spectacular collapse...
Review_body: Hancock opens with an interesting concept: that of the drunk superhero who does more harm than good... and after saving a struggling PR Rep's life (Jason Bateman), Hancock enters into a process to shake his habits and become a "real hero". Sadly, this transformation occurs within a matter of 15-20 minutes on screen, and in a brisk 2 weeks Hancock has become a ridiculously smooth sexy saviour. With another 40 minutes or so to go and nothing to do, the plot decides to cough up twist after twist in a desperate effort to keep things going... with enormous (and overly dramatic) secrets about Hancock's past suddenly pouring on-screen. The film becomes gag-worthy at many points... though I continued to give it a chance until the end.2 stars from me for the fun first 40 minutes.

Review title: Super great movie - the critics are all crazy
Review_body: I really must say that the critics have no idea what they are talking about. I watch movies for pure entertainment and i was truly entertained by this one.Who says heroes have to be perfect. Sure, Hancock has his flaws in the beginning, but he overcomes them. We all make mistakes but those mistakes do not have to shape our future.I think this movie has it all. Great special effects, terrific storyline, and incredible acting. Will Smith proves once again that he is one of the great performers of our time. All of the actors deserve applause. As a writer, I could only hope to write something as good as this movie. I hope there is a sequel planned!

Review title: Major disappoint in Will Smith's latest film
Review_body: Hancock is unfortunately full of disappointment. The movie starts off with the potential to be as good as any of Will Smith's great titles (Ali, Independence Day, I am Legend, etc); but the "twist" suddenly deteriorates the movie and, at least in my mind, it joins the ranks of such a silly film as "My Super Ex-Girlfriend".This isn't your average superhero movie. There really isn't a defined villain or evil Will Smith has to fight besides his own attitude towards the world. Will Smith does a great job for the role, but the story is indeed disappointing. The movie looks like its going great until everything is turned around by a lackluster twist.Also, I'm not sure if this movie is aimed to be an action flick or a comedy. The beginning had lots of wisecracks and smart remarks from Will Smith and company, but by the end of the film the only laughing I was doing was at the poor story being told.Basically the first half of the movie is done to perfection; pure, genuine Will Smith blockbuster, but sadly its turned upside down by a silly twist (Oh, and don't even get me started on the CG)

Review_body: i don't usually comment on movies here but i have to comment on this, because rating is so low.. i don't understand what people expect from movies.. hancock has every kind of material in it and it's end is great. will smith acts great as always, plot is great, scenes are great. and why i like this movie so much is what it is trying to tell at the end.. maybe some of people couldn't catch it, but it is that someone has gotta go anyway, this could be the woman sometimes and sometimes the man.. even superheroes can love and even superheroes can be sorry but that you are a superhero doesn't mean you can hurt someone.. so, if one has gotta go, he/she has gotta go no matter how hard it is.. believe me it is more than an action movie, better watch it twice.. i am sure no one believes that i cried while watching :) :(

It is hard to understand all the negative responses to this movie. I get the fact that people had EXPECTATIONS based upon the troika of Will Smith/Summer Movie/Superhero  like they were looking for that really GREAT MIB sequel.Well, it's not. Get over it.What HANCOCK is is a really good movie and it would be a really good movie whether it came out in the summer or in February. Maybe the problem is that HANCOCK is a superhero movie for adults (and with some of the language, the drinking and where he shoved peoples' heads  this was no Spiderman flick). Ang Lee tried to do this in the first Hulk movie. The film wasn't about the Hulk  it was about Bruce Banner. This movie is about this guy  Hancock  who is a loner, a drunk, anti-social and probably smells bad but has superpowers. Who is he and how did he get here? Hancock would like to know this as much as the audience would.That's the story. This is not a franchise-making, summer toy. This is a story. And for everyone griping about the first-half/second half, from the MOMENT Hancock and Mary met  something was going on. Charlize Theron (amazing as always) did a great job of showing both an attraction and an apprehension of Hancock. I thought for a while she would turn out to be the villain and this thing would jump into Fantastic Four land. I'm glad it didn't. I totally dug the mythology the writers created. It was new! It was fresh! It gave the characters a human depth. And she and Will made it believable. Sure  Jason Bateman played his usual role, but he was a good counter-point to the other two. Will Smith  I thought  gave an excellent performance. For once  his character didn't cruise through the movie on charm. Hancock rarely smiles and he's not the life of the party  but he is a hero, which he proves to himself by the end of the film.See it for yourself. Don't bring expectations and you will be rewarded.

Review title: I enjoyed this movie very much because of its differences.
Review_body: I don't believe any spoilers are listed here. All references to the movie are kept especially generic. Read at your own risk anyway just in case you are uber sensitive. I don't tell you what happened or talk about any specifics.After seeing the previews and thinking to myself that this is a movie worth checking out "sometime" I then saw Will Smith being interviewed on a talk show. His enthusiasm in portraying an atypical super hero combined with how much he loved shooting a flight scene with old-school stunt work plus some special effects instead that would normally be done all CGI got my interest in this movie piqued.I enjoy many types of superhero movies and usually find ways to enjoy most of them. Hancock was no exception, and in this case I found that it really stood apart from other super hero movies in a new and refreshing way. Personally I thought it was new, intricate, funny, and full of "eye candy" (scenes that are especially fun to watch).Will Smith brought some style and flair to the role and gave us a glimpse of a person going through some hard times and going through some changes. I think there was one part of the movie that "dragged" a little for me, but sure enough right around the corner was some more intrigue, action, and other eye candy to watch.I probably laughed the most at a scene that reminded me of the Anal Dwelling Butt Monkey of "Bruce Almighty".

Review title: A new type of super hero
Review_body: I will make a strong recommendation that you go see Hancock and make up your own mind. I read some of the early reviews and comments and I was expecting to be disappointed. What I ended up seeing was a great entertaining movie which was really about 'fate' and however much we try to escape our destiny it has a strange way of bringing us back to it.Don't look for super evil villains, meteors from space, or quick costume changes. Hancock is a new and slightly more human super hero, perhaps the truest representation of a comic book hero we have ever seen. He does not fight for justice and the American way. If there is any fault in the film we are never really told what motivates Hancock to do what he does, but we do know he's alone.I enjoyed Hancock, and more importantly my 11 year old son enjoyed it.

And well frankly people who love only action shooting and that kind of movies well yeah they might not appreciate this movie as much as I did. So get a ticket and go see that movie. Trust me you will not regret it. P.S. One of THE movies of the summer and of the year.
